rice.description: Rice is a staple food and one of the most important cereal crops consumed worldwide.

maize.description: Maize, also known as corn, is a cereal grain first domesticated by indigenous peoples in southern Mexico.

chickpea.description: Chickpea, also known as garbanzo bean, is a legume with edible seeds and is a rich source of protein.

kidneybeans.description: Kidney beans are a variety of common bean and are named for their kidney-like shape.

pigeonpeas.description: Pigeon peas are a tropical legume grown for food, fodder, and fuel.

mothbeans.description: Moth beans are a drought-resistant legume primarily grown in arid and semi-arid regions.

mungbean.description: Mung beans are small green legumes widely cultivated in Asia and used in various culinary dishes.

blackgram.description: Black gram is a type of pulse cultivated in the Indian subcontinent, known for its rich protein content.

lentil.description: Lentils are edible legumes that come in various colors and are a good source of protein and essential nutrients.

pomegranate.description: Pomegranate is a fruit with a tough outer rind and juicy, seed-filled interior, known for its health benefits.

banana.description: Banana is a popular tropical fruit with a sweet taste and is a good source of vitamins and minerals.

mango.description: Mango is a tropical fruit known for its sweet and juicy flesh, commonly consumed fresh or in various culinary dishes.

grapes.description: Grapes are berries that come in various colors and are used for making wine, juices, and dried fruits.

watermelon.description: Watermelon is a refreshing and hydrating fruit with a high water content, commonly enjoyed in hot weather.

muskmelon.description: Muskmelon, also known as cantaloupe, is a sweet and aromatic melon with orange flesh and a netted rind.

apple.description: Apple is a widely cultivated fruit with a crisp texture and sweet or tart flavor, available in various varieties.

orange.description: Orange is a citrus fruit known for its juicy and tangy flavor, rich in vitamin C and other nutrients.

papaya.description: Papaya is a tropical fruit with orange flesh and black seeds, known for its digestive enzymes and health benefits.

coconut.description: Coconut is a versatile fruit with a hard shell, fibrous husk, and edible white flesh, often used in various culinary applications.

cotton.description: Cotton is a soft, fluffy fiber that grows in the bolls of the cotton plant and is commonly used to make textiles.

jute.description: Jute is a long, soft, and shiny vegetable fiber that can be spun into coarse, strong threads and is used for making burlap, hessian, and rope.

coffee.description: Coffee is a brewed beverage made from roasted coffee beans, and it is one of the most popular drinks worldwide.
